Plotting probability distributions across granularities

Source: R/rank_harmony_v0.R
rank_harmony_v0.Rd

Plot probability distribution of univariate series across bivariate temporal granularities.

rank_harmony_v0(
  .data = NULL,
  harmony_tbl = NULL,
  response = NULL,
  prob = seq(0.01, 0.99, 0.01),
  dist_distribution = "normal",
  hierarchy_tbl = NULL,
  dist_ordered = TRUE,
  alpha = 0.05
)

Arguments

.data

a tsibble.
harmony_tbl

A tibble of harmonies and their levels obtained from the function().
response

response variable.
prob

numeric vector of probabilities with values in [0,1].
dist_distribution

Underlying distribution of distances. Look at hist_distance()
hierarchy_tbl

A hierarchy table specifying the hierarchy of units
dist_ordered

if levels of the time granularity is ordered.
alpha

significance level

Value

A tibble of harmonies and their levels ranked in descending order of average maximum pairwise distance of the harmony pairs.

Contents
